thread.title: Roy Keane lays into "shameful" Arsenal for "giving up" against Bayern Munich in the Champions League
thread.title_full: Roy Keane lays into "shameful" Arsenal for "giving up" against Bayern Munich in the Champions League

author: Jake Polden
title: Roy Keane lays into "shameful" Arsenal for "giving up" against Bayern Munich in the Champions League
text:
Sport Roy Keane lays into "shameful" Arsenal for "giving up" against Bayern Munich in the Champions League The former Manchester United man added the Gunners should get rid of the players who don't want to be at the club Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Roy Keane SLAMS "shameful" Arsenal Share this video Get Arsenal FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Roy Keane has slammed Arsenal's "shameful" performance against Bayern Munich after they were dumped out the Champions League on Tuesday. 
The Gunners, who went into the second leg of the last-16 tie already 5-1 down on aggregate, were faced with a seemingly impossible mission to turn the tie around. 
Arsenal started brightly and broke the deadlock through Theo Walcott before Laurent Koscielny was shown a red card and chaos ensued. 
Arsene Wenger's men were battered 5-1 by the German giants for a second time, and Keane, who has been critical of Arsenal in the past, slammed their performance. Roy Keane slams Arsenal's "shameful" performance against Bayern Munich (Photo: ITV) Arsenal were battered 5-1 at the Emirates on Tuesday (Photo: Shaun Botterill) 
"I think certainly the last half an hour or 35 minutes they gave up," said Keane, analysing the game on ITV's Champions League Highlights show. 
"There's no forgiving that. There's no shame losing to Bayern but there is when you down tools for the last half an hour and you lose 10-2. Shameful. 
"Overplaying it from the back. I bet you Bayern couldn't believe their luck. I thought they were shameful the last half an hour. 
"The goals they were giving away and people not running back. Yes they played really well in the first half but gave up in the second half. At this level, at any level, it's ridiculous. Theo Walcott put the Gunners ahead in the second leg clash (Photo: REUTERS) Bayern Munich recorded a 10-2 aggregate win over Arsenal (Photo: Getty Images) 
"The players do a lot of talking off the pitch at Arsenal saying they're behind the manager. 
"You show how much you're behind the manager when you're on the pitch for 90 minutes, and their performance doesn't for one minute suggest they're behind the manager." 
Keane added that Gunners should get rid of the players who don't want to be at the club, but stops short of naming names. poll loading Will this be Wenger's final season as Arsenal boss? 500+ VOTES SO FAR
